name: Potluck Potato Casserole
author: bayard-clark
summary: After trying plenty of hash brown casserole recipes, I finally discovered the perfect mixture on my own! I always make this for any potluck I go to, and it's ALWAYS the first thing to be eaten! From dinner parties to football game gatherings, you won't be disappointed.
ingredients: 1 (10.75 ounce) can  cream of potato soup
½ (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened, or more as needed
½ teaspoon salt, or to taste
1 (16 ounce) package frozen hash brown potatoes
½ cup grated Parmesan cheese, or more to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Mix Cheddar cheese, potato soup, sour cream, cream cheese, green onions, garlic, and salt together in a large bowl
Fold potatoes into the mixture; pour prepared casserole dish
Bake in the preheated oven until bubbling and cheese is golden brown, about 1 hour
